answers.answer: Hello,It can be due to parasthesia skin which is due to dysfunctioning of neurons and can occur due to nerve irritation also. It can be due to diabetes, hypothyroidism, peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency, neurological causes or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar, vitamin B 12 and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. Animal protein is the richest source of vitamin B 12 and if you are a vegetarian then you may be having vitamin B 12 deficiency. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms improve. If the symptoms persist then get an evaluation done from a physician and also get nerve conduction velocity tests done to rule out any nerve irritation.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I have had burning and itching skin for several months and I am miserable!  It started out itching with no rash.  I was tested by an allergist and am not allergic to anything.  He took some blood and sent to Mayo Clinic and tests came back showing I have an overactive thyroid.  My regular MD took a couple more blood tests and she said there is no problem with my thyroid.  I am switching dr's as she is unwilling to help me with the pain at all!  Gone from itching to burning which is painful as well and I have tried all kinds of topical sprays for bites, burns and benedryl spray for skin irritation.  I have no redness, no rash, no bumps of any kind!  I'm going crazy!  What could it be?  Could the regular MD's test results be wrong since the allergist said there was a problem with my thyroid?
title: Burning and itching skin, no rash
